comments:
Unparished area which until 1.4.1974 formed the parishes of Loughborough 
    and Shepshed. See also Table 2, note (p).

That part which until 1.4.1936 formed part of the parish of 
    Charley. See also Table 2, note (i).

Abolished 1.4.1936 and divided between the parishes of Loughborough 
    and Shepshed.

Abolished 1.4.1936 and divided between the parishes of Loughborough, 
    Long Whatton and Shepshed.

Created 1.4.1982 out of the Charnwood unparished area. See also 
    Table 2, note (p).
Abolished 1.10.1902 and added to the parish of Loughborough.

Renamed 14.5.1938 to become the parish of Lockington Hemington. 
    See also Table 2, note (f).

Created 14.5.1938 by renaming the parish of Lockington. See also 
    Table 2, notes (k) and (l).

Renamed 4.8.1999 to become the parish of Long Whatton & 
    Diseworth. See also Table 2, note (f).

Created 4.8.1999 by renaming the parish of Long Whatton. See 
    also Table 2, note (p).

Abolished 1.4.1974 and added to the Charnwood unparished 
    area. See also Table 2, note (h).

Created 1894 from the rural part of the parish of Loughborough. 
    Abolished 1.4.1936 and added to the parish of Loughborough.

That part which until 1.4.1936 formed part of the parish of 
    Woodthorpe. See also Table 2, note (j).

Abolished 1.4.1974 and added to the Charnwood unparished 
    area.

Created 1.4.1982 out of the Charnwood unparished area. See also 
    Table 2, note (p).

Created 1894 from the rural part of the parish of Shepshed. Abolished 
    1.10.1896 and added to the parish of Shepshed.
Abolished 1.4.1936 and added to the parish of Loughborough.

That part which until 1.4.1936 formed part of the parish of 
    Woodthorpe. See also Table 2, note (j).

Abolished 1.4.1936 and divided between the parishes of Loughborough, 
    Quorndon and Woodhouse. See also Table 2, note (j).

That part which until 1.4.1936 formed part of the parish of 
    Breedon on the Hill. See also Table 2, note (i).
